range: Korea (Jeju-do), WC. & S. Japan to E. & S. Taiwan
source: F. Berchtold & J. S. Presl, Prir. rostlin 2:36, 47-56, t. 8.  1825
desc: Camphor trees (sometimes instead classified as Camphora officinarum) grow leaves that produce waxy camphor, an aromatic substance harvested and used in topical and folk medicine. It creates a cool sensation when applied to the skin.
